paragraphs.text: I take the time before 8 am very seriously. I don’t schedule client meetings before 8am. I don’t turn on the TV before 8am. I don’t play music before 8am. I sit around, drink a hot beverage (tea or coffee), write, plan my day, write some more, let the dog out, write some more, stare out the window, write some more. Sometimes I write less and think more. It depends on the day.
paragraphs.name: ac6e
9db0
paragraphs.text: Focus Is Your Most Valuable Skill

I’ve recently gotten in the habit of writing morning pages. This practice, popularized by creative genius Julia Cameron, involves writing three stream of consciousness pages first thing in the morning, with pen and paper. [8]

6d67a7146508.title: I have to agree with you there.

paragraphs.name: 8d21
paragraphs.text: I have to agree with you there. I’m constantly being pulled this way and that. Twitter keeps on a’ buzzin. And social media, while it’s amazing, really digs into your reserves of attention! Then you get to procrastinating, and well, it’s a slow rolling descent into laying on the sofa eating a bag of doritos. It’s fun for a sec, of course, but digital noise can get way, too, I don’t know…noisy?

3aa7e7db299a.title: I’ve done this now for about 5 years and it’s at the point where on those rare days I don’t get…

paragraphs.name: 34c3
paragraphs.text: I’ve done this now for about 5 years and it’s at the point where on those rare days I don’t get this time my day is off. It is my highest focused time of the day, and often sets up the rest of the day for good or bad.

paragraphs.name: bc6b
paragraphs.text: Nice text. I always get astonished with quality long but still all concise pieces like yours. By the way I really liked the morning page thing. Thanks for it.

paragraphs.name: 85d3
paragraphs.text: Thank you for this article. Thanks for pointing out the media’s and products and service’s way of pulling our attention away from us. However, can I ask what your thoughts are on Leonardo Da Vinci? was he multi-tasking in your opinion?

9487f369ef9d.title: I don’t think we can completely compartmentalize ourselves into multi-tasking or single-tasking.

paragraphs.name: 3ce3
paragraphs.text: I don’t think we can completely compartmentalize ourselves into multi-tasking or single-tasking. A balance needs to be maintained between both of these. There will be times in a day when we need to multi-task and then there will be periods of no-distraction, absolute focus.

virtuals.subtitle: In fact today’s millenial generation prides itself to be the only generation which has multi tasking ingrained into its DNA.

content.subtitle: In fact today’s millenial generation prides itself to be the only generation which has multi tasking ingrained into its DNA.
